elements.title: Thomas Lord Busby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Thomas Lord Busby's portrait of the busker Billy Waters (pictured) inspired Derby and Staffordshire figures?

elements.title: had the right to vote in New Jersey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that women originally had the right to vote in New Jersey thanks to its constitution until an 1807 act removed that right?

elements.title: Leo Kestenberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leo Kestenberg, a concert pianist, initiated a large-scale reform of music education in Prussia, but had to flee the Nazis first to Prague and then to Tel Aviv?

elements.title: Half Die (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Banjul sector Half Die was reportedly given its name due to an epidemic outbreak in the 19th century?

elements.title: Team San Juan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Team San Juan became the first champion of the FIBA 3x3 World Tour in 2012?

elements.title: garden refugees (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that garden refugees can become invasive in the wild?

elements.title: Charles K. Prioleau (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the American Civil War, Charles K. Prioleau made a fortune by smuggling arms to the Confederacy on board the blockade runner Bermuda?

elements.title: King Edward's Place (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that King Edward's Place, once a love nest for King Edward VII, later became a children's activity centre?
